title: Avanti turns to regional operator partnerships to expand satellite coverage
summary: U.K.-based Avanti Communications is seeking more partnerships to grow its footprint after securing its first major deal to use another regional satellite operator’s capacity.

title: NASA updates exploration objectives
summary: NASA has revised and expanded a set of objectives it will use to guide its architecture for lunar and Mars exploration after receiving volumes of feedback from commercial and international partners.

title: NASA to Provide Live Coverage of Space Station Crew Activities
summary: Three cosmonauts living aboard the International Space Station are set to return to Earth Thursday, Sept. 29.

title: ULA’s Delta 4 prepares for final West Coast launch as Vandenberg seeks new tenants
summary: After completing the NROL-91 mission, ULA will start vacating SLC-6 and consolidate operations at SLC-3

title: Airbus talks ESM delivery process for upcoming Artemis flights
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) is providing the European Service Module (ESM), the provider of propulsion and life support for the Orion crew capsule. The ESM sits on top of the Interim Cryogenic Propulsion Stage (ICPS) on the Space Launch System (SLS), which is being prepared for its third launch attempt on the Artemis I mission. As the prime contractor for the ESM, Airbus is leading the construction and assembly for ESA.
